keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Anne Barnard in Beirut, Lebanon; Julie Hirschfeld Davis in Washington; Somini Sengupta at the United Nations; and Ivan Nechepurenko in Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The cease-fire is to begin Saturday, but officials acknowledge that obstacles remain in getting the Syrian government and the armed opposition to comply.

headline.print_headline: U.S.-Russia Deal on a Partial Truce in Syria Raises More Doubt Than Optimism
headline.main: U.S.-Russia Deal on a Partial Truce in Syria Raises More Doubt Than Optimism

snippet: The cease-fire is to begin Saturday, but officials acknowledge that obstacles remain in getting the Syrian government and the armed opposition to comply.
abstract: United States and Russia reach tenuous agreement on partial Syrian cease-fire; pact,  which enables humanitarian aid deliveries to besieged cities and calls for cessation of hostilities between Syrian government and rebel forces, does not include militant groups Islamic State and Nusra Front; skeptics question Russia's commitment.
